byline.original: By MATTHEW GOLDSTEIN and ALEXANDRA STEVENSON

abstract: Federal law enforcement and regulatory authorities arrest former Morgan Stanley employee Vitaly Korchevsky, and issue warrants for eight other men, accusing them of operating a five-year rogue trading scheme in which they and dozens of others reaped some $100 million in illegal proceeds; prosecutors accuse group of paying Ukrainian hackers to gain access to corporate news releases and then trading on information; marks largest insider trading case yet brought against those who used hacking as key tool.
lead_paragraph: The international scheme generated more than $100 million in illegal profits, and the S.E.C. is bringing a parallel lawsuit in the case.

headline.main: Nine Charged in Insider Trading Case Tied to Hackers
headline.print_headline: Rogue Traders, Brazen Hackers and a Wave of Arrests

snippet: The international scheme generated more than $100 million in illegal profits, and the S.E.C. is bringing a parallel lawsuit in the case.
